string.value: Adds this Skill to a random ally creature.
Adds this Skill to all ally creatures.
Adds this Skill to a random {y} ally.
Adds this Skill to all {y} allies.
Increases the effect of this Skill for a random ally creature.
Increases the effect of this Skill for all ally creatures.
Increases the effect of this Skill for a random {y} ally.
Increases the effect of this Skill for all {y} allies.
Avoids this many targeted enemy Skills each round.
Every {c} turns, inflicts Confuse on an Enemy creature, causing it to attack an adjacent ally creature.
Attack damage dealt to adjacent creatures is dealt to this creature instead.
Reduces damage taken from each Attack.
After taking Attack damage, deals damage back.
After taking Attack damage, inflicts Corrosive back, reducing Attack until Corrosive is not inflicted for two turns.
At start of turn, permanently increases Attack if opposing creature has more Attack, even while on delay.
At start of turn, grants Empower to a random ally creature, increasing Attack.
At start of turn, grants Empower to all ally creatures, increasing Attack.
At start of turn, grants Empower to a random ally {y}, increasing Attack.
At start of turn, grants Empower to all ally {y}, increasing Attack.
Grants Barrier to a random ally creature, preventing this much damage taken.
Grants Barrier to all ally creatures, preventing this much damage taken.
Grants Barrier to a random {y} ally, preventing this much damage taken.
Grants Barrier to all {y} allies, preventing this much damage taken.
At start of turn, grants adjacent allies Legion, increasing Attack.
At start of turn, grants adjacent {y} allies Legion, increasing Attack.
At start of turn, grants self Fervor for each adjacent creature, increasing Attack.
At start of turn, grants self Fervor for each adjacent {y}, increasing Attack.
Inflicts Hex on a random enemy creature, causing it to take extra damage each time it is damaged.
Inflicts Hex on all enemy creatures, causing them to take extra damage each time they are damaged.
Deals damage to a random enemy creature.
Deals damage to all enemy creatures.
Deals damage to a random {y} enemy.
Deals damage to the opposing creature and its adjacent creatures.
Inflicts Scorch on the opposing creature. Scorch deals damage at end of turn until Scorch is not inflicted for a turn.
Every {c} turns, inflicts Freeze on a random enemy creature, disabling its Attack and activation Skills.
Every {c} turns, inflicts Freeze on all enemy creatures, disabling their Attacks and activation Skills.
Inflicts Weaken on a random enemy creature, reducing Attack.
Inflicts Weaken on all enemy creatures, reducing Attack.
Inflicts Weaken on a random {y} enemy, reducing Attack.
Inflicts Weaken on all {y} enemies, reducing Attack.
Reduces the effect of damage reduction and prevention on Attack damage.
After dealing Attack damage, inflicts Silence, disabling all Skills.
After dealing Attack damage, inflicts Nullify, causing the creature to avoid this many targeted ally Skills.
Every {c} turns, Attacks twice and uses other Skills twice.
After dealing Attack damage, permanently inflicts Poison, dealing damage at end of turn. Poison does not stack.
After dealing Attack damage, heals self.
After dealing Attack damage, permanently increases Attack.
This creature has Vengeance and half as much Shroud and Enraged.
Grants Barrier and half as much Invisibility to self and leftmost ally creature.
After taking Attack damage, inflicts Scorch back.
Inflicts Scorch to the opposing creature and its adjacent creatures.
Grants Enrage to a random ally creature, causing it to permanently increase Attack after taking Attack damage.
Grants Enrage to all ally creatures, causing them to permanently increase Attack after taking Attack damage.
Grants Enrage to a random {y} ally, causing it to permanently increase Attack after taking Attack damage.
Grants Enrage to all {y} allies, causing them to permanently increase Attack after taking Attack damage.
Increases the Scorch value on a Scorched enemy creature, or deal Scorch damage to a random enemy creature
Increases the value of Scorch or Poison on an enemy creature
Creatures damaged by this card are afflicted with Venom, increasing damage dealt to it and dealing additional damage at the end of each turn
Deal damage to random enemy creatures one damage at a time. Does not gain bonus damage from Hex or Venom.
Prevents this much damage taken from Skills or Statuses each round.
After being targeted by an enemy creature's Skill, deals damage back.
Reduces damage taken from each Attack and Skill while on delay or Frozen.
Deals stacking damage to this creature at end of turn. Wears off if not reapplied for a turn.
This creature doesn't attack or activate abilities on its next turn. Activates every {c} turns.
After dying the first time, revives self, healing and removing all effects.
Reduces damage taken from each Attack and Skill while on delay or Frozen.
At end of turn, heals self, even while on delay.
After dealing Attack damage, inflicts Daze, reducing Attack.
At start of turn, grant adjacent allies Legion and half as much Barrier.
At start of turn, grant adjacent {y} allies Legion and half as much Barrier.
After dealing Attack damage, permanently increases Attack and heals self.
Heals a random ally creature and grants Invigorate, permanently increasing max health. Invigorate does not stack.
Heals all ally creatures and grants Invigorate, permanently increasing max health. Invigorate does not stack.
Heals a random {y} ally and grants Invigorate, permanently increasing max health. Invigorate does not stack.
Heals all {y} allies and grants Invigorate, permanently increasing max health. Invigorate does not stack.
After dealing Attack damage, permanently increases Attack of the lowest Attack active ally creature
Grants Barrier and half as much Invisibility to self and leftmost ally creature.
This card is immune to debuffs. Opposing card is inflicted with Nullify 99 at the start of its turn.
When damaged by an attack, Poison the attacker.
"Majestic Hooved Beast, Sky Galloper, Long Faced Bird" - Rejected names from the historical text 'Mythical Nomenclature'.
The fighting prowess of an angel is not questioned by many. At least not for long.
"Woosh woosh woosh woosh" - Ancient Windstorm Elemental saying.
Kestrels are the favored form of guard for noble Aether mages.
Manifestations of the wind itself, these creatures buffet their enemies with strong gusts and laughter.
Foxes often specialize in small magic or illusions, confusing their opponents so they can escape.
Those looking for their secrets can find them under archive "P" for pain.
"Ooooh! Fluffy!" - Last Words of Bilmior the Adventurer
Shot through the heart, and you're to blame.
"It's impossible to attack them when they keep knocking us off our feet!" - Frustrated Soldier
"Jarad, is that bird wearing a suit of armor?" - Unsuspecting Castle Guard
Aether Oracles channel the strength of storms to protect their allies.
The army thought that because he was made of glass, he would shatter easily... right up until arrows deflected off him.
"He's not the frog we deserve, but he is the frog we need." - Samael, Leader of Aether
"They may not have brains, but they have... well, not much." - Aria, Necromancer
Bending the lines between realities, the Phase Imp can poison you before you even know it exists.
"They may not have brains, but they have... well, at least this one is big. That's a start." - Aria, Necromancer
Quick and nimble, they can cut your purse and your stomach before you know they are there.
"I thought you said I had to CROSS the lava, not FIGHT the lava!" - Bilmior the Adventurer
"It's not their speed or their weakening poison you need to look out for, it's their knives!" - Desert Nomad
"I once stepped on one, dang near melted my entire boot!" - Valjhor, Traveling Merchant
Fire Imp tongue is considered by many to be the spiciest food ingredient in the known world. Some days even they cannot handle it.
"Move! Get out of the way! It's going to trample you! ...Eventually." - Wyld Ranger
"Only those that have truly flown can know what it means to fall."
"A thirty foot skeleton or a dragon? I can fight those. This? I cannot even hope to slow this." - Eos, Hero of Llarym
Mischievous by nature, they appear before you can even spot them, and are gone just as fast.
"Beware when sitting on a boulder in the Wyldwood, it may not enjoy your choice of seat." -Tellum, Novice Adventurer
"Have ya ever gotten between a wolf and her pups? No? I wouldn't suggest it." - Wyld Ranger
Some myths claim that the origin of all healing magic came first from the seas, carried by the hands of mermaids.
"They say he doesn't talk much, but I disagree. I've seen him do a lot of talking with that sword." - Frans, Elaria Bartender
"Mark my words, that squirrel is smarter than it looks!" - Valjhor, moments after his magical trinkets were stolen.
Their prey is lured in with their hypnotic lantern. The last thing they see is the large mouth before everything goes dark.
Slow and steady... crushes its enemies underfoot.
Protectors of Elaria, they tread the woodland as their second home.
"Their poison can bring a full grown Tusker to its knees" - Elyse, Ranger
"No one is allowed to touch these bunnies."
When angered, they pull the energy of the earth around them to glow with awesome power.
"Their scouts are invaluable, but we need to stop letting them name the new settlements. I can't take another Flytopia." - Expedition Researcher
"Sticks and stones can break my bones... No, that's the end of the rhyme." - Frans, Elaria Bartender
Champion of the people, master of all armaments.
"Brushing your finger along the wrong rune can unleash its stored magic to disastrous effects." - Last Lesson of Magi Neyaroi
"What they lack in intelligence, they make up for in numbers." - Decim, the Firebringer
One touch can pull the life force right out of you.
"He looks so happy!" "Of course he does. He just found lunch!" - Boloros Sailors
"Some say they grow to harness the energy of the sky. And some say they just eat a storm cloud and turn dark." - Magi Neyaroi
"Why are we losing to a horse with wings!? And why is it GLOWING?!?" - Bilmior the Adventurer
"Are you from heaven? Because the fall might kill you."
The extra lighting helps to prevent mid air collisions with other angels in the dark of night.
"The gathering energy of the Aether can purify even the most violent of creatures." - Yuriel, Owl Mystic
Having gathered the natural energy of Aether lands, the Kestrel transcends its physical form.
"...and there she was, in the center of the forest alone, sweet as the wind and sharp as a blade." - Ballad of Vularias IX
"Without warning nor word, the soul of the wind fell upon us like a hammer to the forge." - Ballad of Vularias IX
"And you thought my COUSIN was mean?"
Soothing the mind and the body.
Every ship on the sea is a perfectly fine lightning rod.
The path of least resistance is you.
Many battles won, many hearts conquered.
Oda was born in a far away land, shipwrecked, and raised on a remote island temple. He's ventured in search of spellstones as a pilgrimage for his order and honor.
The Grand Library of the Aether has been curated by the Owl Mystics for hundreds of years. Their knowledge is accumulated in Yuriel through their ancestral bloodline.
Samael is the powerful and stoic leader of the Aether faction of magic. Don't ask him about the difference between bird wings and angel wings.
Aria is a powerful necromancer who aligns herself with Chaos magic. She likes long walks by moonlight and 'making' new friends.

Decim has always had an affinity for fire magic, even before being exiled from his village after it mysteriously burned down. An accident with a stolen spellstone imbued him with powerful abilities while also taking most of his sanity.
Wrapped in the cold winds of death, Tarian sits upon his throne as the center of the Chaos. Well respected, and well feared. He's a skeleton afterall.
Elyse lived a simple life on the edge of civilization until adulthood, giving her a burning spirit for adventure and the tools to track it.
Ursurio is a respected representative of the Wyld despite his often aloof attitude and outlook. And hunger cravings.
An ancient being of living stone, Groc wanders the wilderness in search of wisdom. You don't want to be between him and a hard place.
A horde of risen creatures and skeletons, mindlessly attacking anything within reach.
The Wyldwood does not take kindly to strangers, and its creatures vigorously defend its borders.
The Elaria Captain is the first line of defense for the researchers of the Elaria encampment. Part of his responsibilities is taking new arrivals and training them.
A native of Luminis and a natural defender of the realm.
Manifestations of the raw energy of the world around them.
The rivers of Luminis run deeper than they appear, housing many of the sea's dangers.
A flood of demons and monsters, centered around a large titan at their head.
"They came right through the walls." - Marr, Blacksmith
Primal forces of the void, manifested as the nightmares of the living.
"The Orobas is possibly the most frightening creature in all of Karthos. Or at least the biggest." - Magi Neyaroi
In the untamed wasteland of Karthos, wraiths tend to congregate and create dangerous dens that lure other powerful beasts.
The dangerous and only path to The Void.
The father of spellstone research, he is the greatest mind in his field. Even with some of it missing.
The wurm breaks out of the ground suddenly, spraying rock in all directions as it belows a sound like a thousand trumpets.
The ground shatters to reveal a huge anomoly made of shadows and smoke. Eyes peer out at the adventurers below as its massive form swings and crushes stone.
Elyse is a new adventurer like yourself. She's training with the Captain, though she seems more than eager to be out on her own.
Oda is a new adventurer like yourself. He trains alongside you, but seems very reserved and quiet.
A long wolf lurks throughout the woods. Its movements unnatural, the look in its eyes dangerous.
A former leader of a Chaos faction, his mind has been tainted by some foul magic that causes him to act dangerously against the other factions and his own.
Incarnations of the Void itself, manifested into small servents of mayhem.
And you thought my COUSIN was mean?
A pair of unusually large fire titan twins, Jar and Mar.
An Aether creature freed when the undead ravaged the researchers' camp in Elaria.
These undead move with purpose and in unity. They are not like the shambling undead that wander the camp.
An army of undead warriors, their glowing eyes shine in the night and their blades drag on the ground.
In the wastes, no one can hear you howl.
You idley wonder how this little crab got here, right before it snips your finger.
The shadows of night cloak that which lurks in the wastes.
Creatures of pure corruption. They rise from the ground like shadows given life.
Aria's favorite skeleton companion and possibly only friend. His name is Little Tarian.
Aria has fallen to the corruption of the Void.
The dragons of Tarragon Peak have gone into a frenzy after a series of earthquakes around the mountain.
An ancient beast that lives deep in the earth. Rarely seen above ground. Considered extremely dangerous by most adventurers.
A manifestation of pure arcane powers. The Dustling only appears when a gap of power occurs in the shifting realities.
The combination of Arcane Fragments. It has little combat use, but is a great source of resources.
A small chunk of Spellstone material, broken from a larger Spellstone. It has little combat use, but can be Vaporized for resources.
A deposit of Spellstone ore with no creature inside. It has little combat use, but can be Vaporized for resources.
A massive deposit of Spellstone ore. It has little combat use, but can be Vaporized for resources.
The Aether thrive on order and light.
Fire and brimstone power the Chaos faction and their undead allies.
The strength of earth and nature back the Wyldkin.
The Good, the Bad, and the Fiery
With the advent of crystal expeditions, new adventurers are needed to contain and fight the creatures that break out of these ancient Spellstones. You've traveled to Elaria for just that purpose.
You've met up with a Captain of the Elaria expedition on your arrival. He's offered to team up with you to help train on your quest for the Heart of Blue Fire, but others aren't as thrilled.
This is the Elaria Expedition, the forefront a' Spellstone harvesting and the edge o' civilization as we know it!
Oda, come ova' here and help me show this new kid the ropes!
A band of undead have wandered into the camp, causing mayhem. You spot a traveler's pack amongst them. An unfortunate merchant seems to be trapped!
Hah! You seem to be gettin' th' hang of it, now le-...
Undead in the camp?!! Look! A merchant is cornered by some of the skeletons!
Hey there, uh... skeleton... friend? Can I interest you in a new sword? Only 23,000 gold!
The undead have been rounded up, but some still struggle! Finish them off and keep the researchers safe!
Round up the last of these undead! Let's finish them off!
I'll stay with the researchers and keep them safe!
With the undead taken care of, the captain has brought you to a new section of the camp. Here you come across Oda once more, deep in meditation.
Some creatures 'ave special powers. Learning how to fight against these skills will be key. Oda! Com'ere!
Those undead appearing has put me on edge. This time I won't hold back.
The Captain takes you near the excavation. Near the bottom of the site you can see the top of what looks to be a massive chest.
If ya ever need to know more about an enemy tap them to bring up your field journal!
What is that buried in the center of the excavation?
That? It's th' cache that we're here to dig up. The researchers think it might be the Heart of Blue Fire, but they can't get it open.
While you were training with the captain and Oda, undead swarmed out of the forest and invaded the camp. They seem to be focusing on the buried cache.
The undead have returned!! Use your magic to help defend the researchers!
A group of researchers has been cornered by a shambling band of skeleton warriors. Help the captain defeat the undead and get to them.
Captain! There are researchers here that need help!
Sorry Oda, I'm a tad bit occupied! Get off me ya' grubbin' bones! Back to the earth with ya!
The undead are using lightning to destroy the excavation tools. Clear them out before they make it impossible to harvest crystals!
The equipment! Clear those blasted undead out! We can't afford to lose those tools!
Those red spirits are the ones creating the lightning! Send your strongest after them!
The undead have broken through our southern defenses and are pouring into the barracks. Stop them before they reach the defenseless researchers of the expedition.
Captain! I came as soon as I heard the shouts! Where do you need me?
The southern defensive line jus' buckled! Th' undead are pourin' in!
That's where the researchers are! We have to do something! Let's go!
The flame spirits have set fire to much of the lower camp. A number of Spellstones the researchers were studying have been shattered, releasing the creatures within.
The undead are shattering the researchers' Spellstones!
The Aether creatures being released are confused. We must calm their minds.
The undead, angels, and pegasus are now running wild in the camp! To make matters worse, the buried cache has disappeared in the chaos!
Sir! The cache with the Heart of Blue Fire is missing!!!
These creatures are everywhere! Clear th' expedition and make sure the researchers are safe first!
The undead still come from the woods, and they bring a corruption with them that poisons the land. Push them back and hold that bridge before it is too late!
The expedition camp is clear, but th' undead continue and the cache is still missing. Someone is behind this.
The undead have been bottlenecked at the bridge, but something is driving them forward with unnatural force. Defeat them here and find out who is behind this attack!
You've broken through the ranks of the undead, but they still pour over from the far side. A scout has spotted a cloaked figure on the bridge.
One of our frog scouts spotted a cloaked figure near th' bridge behind a wall o' undead. It might be the one behind this, check it out.
You've found a Chaos mage that has been controlling the undead from behind the scenes! Confront her on the bridge and defeat them!
So you're the one who has defeated my precious minions? I shall add you to my collection!!
With Aria defeated, the undead are now wandering aimlessly with no direction at all. To make matters worse, the cache is still missing!
Aria, you better help clean up yer mess! The three of you will need to find the missing cache without me.
The undead are scattered through the nearby trees. You enter the Wyldwood, but get the feeling that you are being... watched.
The undead must have gone this way. I can still feel their chaotic magic lingering in the trees.
I don't like this... I can barely see where we are going.
The canopy above you grows tighter and the shadows darker. As you try to track the remaining undead, you start to feel uneasy.
In the deepest part of the woods you come across a stranger fighting against immense beasts. You rush to his side to help.
A person?! Leave him, let's find the rest of my undead.
ANOTHER?! COME'ERE, I ENJOY THE CHALLENGE!
I'm going to help him. You can go if you want Aria.
As you leave the deepest part of the woods, the wind starts to pick up between the trees. As you come to a clearing, you are attacked by some cyclone elementals.
The wind is picking up. I'm sensing something unnatural nearby.
As you leave the deepest part of the woods, you come upon a branching pathway. It appears as if something large was dragged through the soil here recently.
At a fork in the forest, you hear the gurgling growl of an undead down the northern path. Following the path, you find a band of undead fighting against Wyld creatures.
There is something wrong with them. I cannot touch their minds with my magic.
If we follow them, they should lead us to the cache.
You follow the undead to a small hollow, and there sitting upon the missing cache is a large man. He turns towards you, his eyes etched with the signs of insanity.
Up ahead in the hollow... There's the cache!
So you've finally caught up to me? Have a taste of THIS!
This aura... it's the same that took control of me!!
Commander Ursurio reveals that the Heart of Blue Fire was never in Elaria, but that the Aether leader Samael knows its location.
The Heart was never here in Elaria, that cache appears to have just been a trapped creature. Poor thing, looked hungry.
Aria and Oda will search for the Heart of Blue Fire on their own. Adventurer, travel with Elyse and Ursurio to Luminis to find what they know.
The Aether have the largest archives on the continent, they should know something about this corruption and the Heart of Blue Fire.
With the unexpected company of Commander Ursurio, you and Elyse travel towards the Aether capital of Luminis. The woods between Luminis and Elaria are dark and full of dangers.
You want food? I have food.
What? No. I was wondering why you decided to come with... actually, nevermind.
You continue through the forest between the two territories, but begin to get the feeling that you are not alone.
The trees begin to thin, light breaking through the canopy of the woods. Growling can be heard as you near the edge of the woods. Suddenly a pack of hungry wolves descends on the party.
These wolves look hungry. Do you think they want food? I don't like to share.
Forget about the food, this one is nipping at my heels!!!!
It appears as if you have stumbled into a soul wisp gathering deep in the woods on your path to meet the Aether. They've turned hostile to your presence.
These are the same as the creature from the cache... Can we eat them?
W-What?! Why are you not scared!!?! Whatever. GET THEM!
The soul wisps gather around, swarming your party and forcing you to flee their small hollow.
The soul wisps have chased you out of their grove, but they are relentless. Also spooky.
Will not eat! WILL NOT EAT!
Who knew those little things could be so tough?!
You have come across an Aether creature that is bent on turning you away. By force if necessary.
Halt! Whoooo goes there? You are trespassing on Aether lands.
Turn back or face my wrath.
You were able to lose the Owl Mystic after the battle, but you've become lost in the woods. With nothing else to go on, you approach a nearby river.
*Ear twitches* I can hear running water. There is a river nearby.
I'm a bit more concerned with these flying rodents!
You manage to find a bridge, the gleam of a city on the horizon. However the denizens of the river seem to be protecting the passage.
Who dares to try and cross our waters?
We need to get to the Aether capital! We seek important information!
We told you to head back. We care not for your business with the light ones.
The denizens of the river are sworn to protect their home, and they have deemed you a threat. You cannot pass the bridge until you defeat them.
The creatures living in the river's waters summon the last of their strength to stop you from crossing the bridge. Overcome their swell of strength to pass through.
ELEMENTALS! Stop these intruders who seek to taint your waters!
You've finally made it to Luminis, but the Owl Mystic Yuriel was waiting for your arrival. You must defeat him to get an audience with the leader of the Aether.
The ones I fought in the north? I see my 'persuassion' was not convincing enough. Allow me to reiterate the lesson.
After proving your strength against Yuriel, he has decided to allow you entrance to the capital itself.
How dare you blemish our sanctified cit-!!
Yuriel, what is the meaning of this? If these outsiders wish an audience, I will grant it.
You've finally been granted access to Luminis, but the Aether leader refuses to listen to your words.
Who are you and what news have you brought to our land?
We come from Elaria where we sought the Heart of Blue Fire. A Chaos mage attacked us and she was under a strange-
The Chaos have always been a dangerous and unpredictable faction, outsider. Begone, your kind are no longer welcome.
The Aether refuse to listen to the warnings you brought to them. They have closed their ears and sent their champion after you.
I have heard enough. The Aether have no time for this. Yuriel! Exile these outsiders.
What? What did we do?! We are telling you there is a strange and tainted magi-!!
Samael does not wish to hear your ramblings. Leave!
You have been driven from the city of Luminis without a scrap of information. To make matters worse, the Aether forces still follow to assure you do not return.
They still chase us like fish down stream? They must really not like you.
Leave our lands! Do not return with your wasteful words. Samael has spoken.
You have momentarily escaped the arm of Luminis and their Aether mages, but the land itself senses that you are not welcome and harrasses you at every turn.
Finally, we made it out of that bright place...
There is a wolf up ahead.
What is wrong with that beast? He looks sick.
While escaping the city of Luminis, you have come across a group of sick animals. It appears to be the same corruption as the Chaos mage.
The Owl Mystic Yuriel has harried your party to the edges of the land.
Leave and never return. Allow me to help you remember the lesson.
As the sun begins to set you seek shelter. The ordeal in Luminis has left you weary.
We need to find shelter before night.
And food. I could eat seventeen salmon.
In the distance, you spot a castle on an outcropping of rock. You've decided to approach it to find shelter and rest.
As you approach the castle, you can tell something is strange. You are set upon by various creatures, some of which are Chaos.
Something is wrong. Do you see the wildlife down there? They look like the Chaos back in Elaria.
At the edge of Luminis you found an abandoned castle in the mountains. Before you can even reach it, you are assaulted by a familiar Chaos mage.
What is that ahead? In that old castle? Maybe something we can eat-
What have we here? Oh, the ones that drove me from Elaria? This should be FUN.
You've taken your airship to meet up with Aria, who was sent to the Chaos home of Karthos in search of the Heart.
Welcome to Karthos, the hospitable home of the Chaos mages.
I don't think I would use the word 'hospitable' for a place where everything is made of fire.
OUCH! Why is everything always so angry where we go?
You've disturbed a nest of Lava Crabs! They come at you with pincers at the ready!
You follow Aria as you begin your walk towards Karthos. Unfortunately, everything appears to be hostile here and you are quickly attacked.
It's unfortunate that you must walk the rest of the way. However, taking an airship any closer would be... unwise.
It's unfortunate that this place is all rocks. And lava. Rocks and lava. And meanness. Rocks, lava and meanness.
As you defeat the final Chaos creature, a great roar is heard. A huge titan of fire comes around a cliff, drawn by the sound of battle.
What is that pounding in the ground?
... I want to make that creature mine.
You press towards the capital of Karthos with Aria while she reveals more about the Chaos.
It's no surprise Samael refused to listen. The Aether have always been stubborn. They believe they are above the rest of us. We know there is an evil coming.
As you near Karthos you can see the lair rising out of the rocks, Aria continues to enlighten you on the nature of the Chaos.
What?! No, not all Chaos are 'evil'. Mischievous maybe, and some are evil, but not all.
I believe that crab is evil.
Karthos is larger than you first thought. As you come closer you can hear some kind of disturbance in the distance.
A horde of Chaos creatures lay siege to Karthos. There is no path around. You must fight through them to get inside.
There is no other way into Karthos. The path is blocked.
You have finally arrived at the Chaos lair of Karthos and broken through the siege.
Oh-hoho! Aria, what a pleasant surprise. I heard you had lost your flaming mind in Elaria.
Decim, I guess since you are here that this siege is your doing?
The fight with Decim spills into the lair itself, filling its halls with fire as his laughter echos off the walls.
Oh-hoho! Your friend here is strong, Aria! I like them.
Why are you sieging Karthos? Do you wish to upset Tarien?
You might as well ask why I breathe, Aria! Hehehe!
As you fight with Decim, the gates of the lair break open and in pour the Chaos that have been sieging the lair.
The gates have broken! The creature from outside are coming in!
You have come face to face with Tarian, leader of the Chaos mages. Before he can ask him what he knows of the Heart of Blue Fire, a figure attacks from the shadows.
Bar the door! Blast anyone who walks through there. I am done playing games with that child Decim.
Aria. What have you brought back with you?
Tarian, I bring the commander who helped break me free of the Vo- Who is that?
*Moves out of the shadows, knife in hand*
After stopping the Void Assassin's attempt to kill Tarian you have been charged to travel out of the city of Karthos and towards the Caverns of Crossing.
It appears The Void are more aggressive than we thought. They may have uncovered the Heart of Blue Fire themselves...
If only the Aether would get off their high pedestal and listen-
Aria, take them to the Caverns of Crossing and into The Void. It is beyond time for us to take this fight to their heart.
The bridges cross the chasm to get around the river of lava. Aria leads the way, but you can see Chaos creatures all around you.
That is... a lot of lava and fire.
We will be taking the bridges that connect the islands. The Caverns of Crossing are on the far side.
Crossing the bridges, you find many Chaos who have taken to living on it and who do not like the presence of Ursurio.
On the center island between bridges, you are attacked by a huge group of Chaos creatures lead by a pair of Fire Titans.
Should we be concerned about these...?
That would probably be a good idea.
After crossing the river of lava, you come to the far side. Aria notices some strange patterns with the Chaos creatures and decides something must be done.
This is strange. There are more creatures here than normal.
Great, more reason to keep movin-
We need to clear them out. Something about their patterns of attack are strange.
If they manage to take the bridges while we are gone we will have no way to return.
Trying to clear out the Chaos near the bridge proves to be harder than thought. There seems to be more than anticipated, and Aria seems to know something that she is not sharing.
WOAH! Where did all of these Chaos come from?! This is like sticking your head in the beehive for a taste of honey!
As the Chaos swarm, you cut through their ranks and follow Aria as she seeks out her goal.
Clearing the last wave of undead and firey beasts has uncovered the real reason for their gathering. A den of Wraiths has gathered, drawing all nearby creatures to their power. Clear out the den!
I've never seen anything like this...
It's a den of Wraiths. Its one of the most dangerous occurrences in these lands.
Normally we leave them be, but this close to the Karthos could cause more issues if we do nothing.
As you near the Caverns of Crossing, you are ambushed by a group of Void creatures.
Above, On the ridge! Open your eyes!
The minions of The Void pull back momentarily, giving you a moment to rest before attacking with a second wave. They seem persistent to stop you from making it to the caverns.
No, they are just preparing a second wave.
The second wave crashes down around you. You've survived the initial clash, but they just keep coming.
As the second wave retreats in defeat you feel the very earth itself shudder under your feet. A gigantic hand of fire reaches out of the cavern, pulling forth a massive Orobas.
Hah! Take that ya' stinking mongrels!
What do you mean? We won the- What is THAT?!
After the defeat of Orobos at the entrance to the Caverns of Crossing, you proceed into the dark tunnels themselves.
I really enjoyed the part where the Orobas split the ground with its fire whip. That was exciting.
I think I am starting to be able to tell when you are making the sarcasm.
Oh really? That's good, I was beginning to think I was putting a show on for myself.
The caverns present many enemies that try to bar your way. As the tunnels twist and turn you find yourself crossing an underground chasm.
Deep tremors shake the caverns as you make your way through them. Aria leads you though the twists and turns, but even she seems unsure of the correct way.
What was that rumbling? Was that an earthquake?
No, I don't think those were natural.
Not natural? What exactly does THAT mean?
Mr. Bear, Tear Down This Wall
The caverns have grown dangerous due to the tremors and you've come to a dead end. Aria says this is where the exit should be located.
I think it is concerning that I might be developing the claustrophobia.
The exit should be here, but it looks like it might have collapsed-
After escaping the Caverns of Crossing, you take your first steps into the territory known as The Void. Spotting a nearby ridge, the party approaches it to find out where they are.
What is that smell? Smells like burning.
The hike out of the pits near the caverns proves to be more dangerous than first thought.
-and then I said to him, 'No, you're not a wet bear, you're a DRIZZLY BEAR!' Bwhahahahaha!
At the top of the ridge overlooking all of The Void is a familiar figure sitting in meditation. He opens an eye as you approach.
... Aria, Commander Ursurio. I see you are doing well.
What are you doing out here on this ridge alone?
My mission was to find the Grand Excavator. I am not sure how successful I was...
You follow Oda further up the ridge where you can oversee all of The Void. There you meet the Grand Excavator.
You won't take the Great Hermit Malchior down so EASILY!
Malchior, sir, these people are not here to-
That's EXACTLY what a minion of The Void would say if I thought they were a minion of The Void! ON GUARD VILE BEASTS!
After fighting with Malchior, the Grand Hermit has decided that you are indeed not corrupted by The Void. Of course he is still not making much sense.
Wait. You're not corrupted by The Void at all.
Yes. We are quite aware of that point, thank you.
Then maybe it's not too late. We could still contain it. The Void has already gotten the Heart!
Few Crystals Short of a Load
As you travel further into The Void, Malchior's ramblings become rather concerning.
Forward, comrades! If you've come here it means there is not much cucumbers! .. I mean time! Time- no, not much time.
... I don't think our friend is all here. Does he know where to find the Heart of Blue Fire?
This is what I feared. I am not even sure if he knows where he is, much less the Heart.
As you descend down the ridge, the tremors from earlier grow stronger. You seem to be nearing their source.
At the base of a massive crater, a gigantic wurm bursts from its den. It sends rock and debris in every direction, before turning its attention towards the party.
Tremors... there was SOMETHING important about these tremors...
Malchior... sir... I think we should sit down and tal-
Ah, YES! The TREMOR WURM! That's what causes the tremors! Of course.
Malchior reveals that the Void have found the Heart of Blue Fire. The Heart is apparently the source of the corruption that is reaching across the land.
Well done. The Tremor Wurm is quite the ferocious beast.
I noticed. Now what did you mean when you said "we can still contain it"?
The Heart of Blue Fire! The crystal harvesting worldwide has weakened it. The Jomar-Laws perimeter breached its maximum toligarm and has...
Does anyone know what this strange little man is saying? Because I'm just getting hungry listening to him...
At Malchior's lead, the group heads across the crater and towards the Void's Core. Unfortunately the land between here and there is full of creatures already corrupted.
Malchior, sir... you claim that the Heart is being used by the Void spread its corruption but that it can be contained, is that correct?
Yes, yes. It is quite simple.
I feel like that is less than true.
The creatures you just fought off rise up, attacking again. They seem to be determined to stop you.
... and the conduit quadrant of the Bo Turvar axis will collapse upon itself! Simple!
... I didn't understand any of those words.
The group approaches a series of narrow gorges in The Void that they must pass to get to the lands beyond.
Let's keep moving... we don't have the luxury to wait. I feel that time is not on our side.
As your group passes through a narrow gorge, you are ambushed by a raid of corrupted Aether. You spot them just in time to defend yourself.
Those look like Aether- what is such a large group of them doing out here?
WhooooOOOOoooooo. You don't look familiar. Do I know you?
Ah, I've studied these before. The Soul Wisps gather together into flocks that build their energy, empowering-
The Aether pull back only to collapse upon you a second time, pushing their attack harder.
You've come across the Owl Mystic Yuriel out in The Void. You are surprised to see him, and he goes on the offensive before you can find out why he is here.
Stop right there! I cannot allow you to proceed any further!
Yuriel?! What are you doing here?
Yuriel reveals that the Aether, led by Samael, have come to The Void to harness the power of the Heart of Blue Fire for themselves. They plan to destroy the Chaos once and for all with its power.
Samael has charged me with the guard of this pass. I will not allow you to interrupt him.
You know not of the power the Heart of Blue Fire contains!
We will take this corruption and purify it with the cleansing light!
Samael has claimed this power for the Aether, and with it we will finally rid ourselves of the Chaos.
So you knew about the corruption all along?!
With the defeat of Yuriel, the party heads into the Void Core. Below where you stand is what appears to be a huge black crystal of immense size. Before it stands Samael, the leader of the Aether.
I see you have laid low Yuriel's honor. It is disgraceful that he lost to such insignificant foes as yourself.
Samael's plan to take the Heart of Blue Fire for his own ascension comes to a head. You must stop him before he takes that power and uses it to destroy the Chaos and Wyld!
You underestimate the Chaos as always, Samael. That will be your downfall!
My unraveling will never come from such weak opposition. Come! Let me show you the true might of the Aether!
Samael approaches the crystal, energy wrapping around the room as he reaches out to draw energy from the Heart of Blue Fire.
HAH! You still think you can win?! PETTY MORTALS, BOW BEFORE THE GREATNESS THAT IS MY POWER!
We need to stop him from breaking the crystal!
Samael breaks the crystal that holds the Heart of Blue Fire, unsealing a Void monster within. You have one chance at containing it before it escapes.
What?! NO!! HOW CAN THIS BE- ARRRGGGGGgggg-
The energy is too much for him; it will rip him apart. We must fall bac-
No. We need to contain the Heart no matter the cost.
Before her attack on Elaria, Aria travels to the Salt Wastes in search of an ancient power.
The glyphs spoke of an ancient power sealed away here. If I could just get my hands on it...
Don't you look at me like that. I told you it would be a long walk and you wanted to come.
Now that Aria has arrived in the Salt Wastes, she starts to travel towards their center like the glyphs described.
The wasteland in this part of the world is harsh, and the creatures that live in it are desperate to survive.
You come across a stretch of earth with no creatures in sight. Just as you begin to wonder why, a lonely lava crab scuttles out from some rocks and steals your skeleton companion's leg bone.
All the creatures avoid this area of the Salt Wastes. Maybe it is a key to the location of the power...
Hey! Give that fibula back! You can't just take bones off people, er... skeleton... things!
Chasing the lava crab took you down into a valley. You can see a monument in the distance.
The monument appears to be a landmark, directing travelers further south through the wasteland.
It's just a landmark, why would someone build this way out here?
I suppose you could be right...
Wait- was that you? I don't think we are alone.
As you defeat the wraits, the long shadows cast by the monument come to life, rising and attacking.
That was close, those wraiths almost overtook us. Nothing is a match for us though.
The ground shatters around your feet. Aria and her minion flee the valley but cannot outrun the Voidlings.
The entire Salt Wastes seems to quake as the Voidlings multiply. The creatures of the wastes seem to fall to their corrupt and begin to attack Aria.
Aria breaks free of the Voidlings, running towards a nearby temple in search of sanctuary.
What are these things?! I've never seen anything like them!
Aria makes a break for the temple, trying to escape the Voidling's grasp. She is finding it harder to think clearly.
There! If we can just make it to that temple!
Aria locks herself in the temple, finally finding safety from the Voidlings outside. However, it seems that the temple is not as safe as she believed.
Finally. We're. Safe. I haven't run like that in a long time.
The Voidlings touch Aria's mind, filling her with confusion and visions of destruction. She summons as much Chaos magic as she can to fight them off.
No! Get out of my mind!
The Voidlings grasp Aria's mind. The necromancer is having trouble holding onto her own consciousness.
With a scream Aria dashes further into the temple, leaving her skeleton familiar behind.
Aria's skeleton familiar follows her deeper into the temple, looking to find the young woman. When he does, she lashes out at him.
Who are you? Where am I?! STAY AWAY!
The Voidlings close in and for a brief moment Aria feels something beyond them, something larger. Then all she remembers is darkness.
Aria has been completely controlled. She strikes out against everything nearby, looking to destroy anything she can.

A dragon tamer has sent an emergency plea to all nearby adventurers. A series of quakes have sent the dragons of Tarragon Peak into a frenzy and many of the younger hatchlings are now missing and must be found!
Oh thank the fire lord, you've arrived!
Help us fight the frenzied dragons and help collect the lost hatchlings!
A quake has definitely taken place here recently. The ground is split in numerous places and the dragons that live here have been stirred into a frenzy because of it.
You hear the cries of dragon hatchlings in the distance. As you near them another out of control dragon flies overhead and swoops down on you.
A flash of fire draws you towards a small valley of lava. You peer around a pair of boulders to see Decim finishing an adult dragon off alone.
Who's there? You want to fight? Let's go!
After you defeat Decim, he agrees to help you if you just don't harm him any further. You are not sure if you can trust him but you can use all the hands you can get.
Okay, OKAY! Stop, I will help you. You don't need to be so hot headed about it! So what are we looking for? Baby dragons?
It seems like there are plenty of full size dragons here to go around, maybe we should leave them?
The quakes have brought the Orobas out of the mountains and into the valley. It rampages through the dragons, causing chaos where ever it goes.
Adventurer! Come this way! A beast has wandered down the mountain because of the quake and is attacking anything that comes near it!

Upon hearing of rare breed of dragons trapped in Spellstones at the base of the mountain, Decim turns on you to try and take the power all for himself. Defeat his forces and find the Spellstone before he does!
It seems our time together is at an end. Those dragons will be mine! Allow me to eliminate the competition.
The lands at the base of the mountain have taken years of punishment from dragon's fire. The rock that use to be at the base has been seared to Obsidian, perfect for incubating dragon eggs.
Halfway up the mountain the ground grows warm and the dragons more dense. This is the heart of the dragon's roost, and from here you can find the embers needed to heat the obsidian to hatch an egg.

At the peak of the mountain lives the Ice Dragon, sitting on its roost and destroying anyone that comes near. Distract it long enough to grab one of the eggs it has stolen and bring it back down the mountain!
On the far side of the island is a small flat plataeu filled with wind elementals. As you near, they attack.
The wind elementals continue to attack. Hold your ground and defend yourselves before they destroy the surrounding area.
Purchase your first Basic Pack from the store.
Nice airship! Where can I set myself up?
Don't be like that. Come! I have something to show you!
Purchase three Basic Packs from the store.
Complete your training with the Raven!
Complete the 'Rise of the Dead' campaign.
Complete 'The Good, the Bad and the Fiery' campaign.
It appears that this young Chaos mage was under some kind of mind control.
She seems to have gotten her wits, but the undead are now roaming without purpose and I am wounded. Choose a new hero to help lead your party.
Thanks for the help! I was on my way to deliver these bounties when I came across those beasts.
Bounties? What kind of bounties are out here in this frontier wilderness?
There are many who do not follow a noble path, my friend. They raid where others would help.
Is there anything we can do to help? It sounds like this is a serious problem.
Not to mention lucrative. Just look at those rewards...
Here, if you can handle these I can make sure more follow. Consider it a token of gratitude from a fellow adventurer.
Grab the edge of the cache. Here we go. One... Two... LIFT!
WHOOOoooooOOOO!!! Who are you? Where am I?!
That doesn't look like a Heart of Blue Fire.
It's not, it's just an Aether creature.
C-c-commander Ursurio!? When did you get here?
Complete the 'Castle on the Rocks' campaign.
I am going to travel back to Elaria to report this to the expedition. That general re-appearing has me worried.
I agree. I will continue to travel with our friend to Karthos, maybe Aria has found more answers.
Complete the 'Karthos, Lair of Chaos' campaign.
It exploded! I've never seen anything that terrifying!
I don't want to see anything that terrifying ever again.
I have a distinct feeling that this was not the last we've seen of the void. This appeared to be but a mere avatar.
You're saying we might have to fight them again? At least the next time we will have the Heart of Blue Fire.
Yes, we've gained a powerful weapon today in our fight against the void.

Follow the events leading to Aria's fall against the corruption that took control of her mind.
Continue Aria's adventure as she uncovers what lies hidden in the Salt Wastes.
The conclusion of Aria's Fall to the corruption that took control of her and sent her on a collision path with Elaria!
You receive a plea for help as calamity strikes the dragon home of Tarragon Peak!
Treasure and betrayal await you in the second chapter of Tarragon Peak!
A second quake strikes, leaving the fate of the peak in question. Find the rare Dragon's Egg and hatch a dragon of your own!
The second series of quakes has uncovered a massive deposit of Spellstones! Assemble your guild and fight for control of the peak!
The Age of Dragons has arrived! Dragons are more powerful than ever!
Complete Bounties to earn Brawl Points, increase in rank, and win exclusive rewards!

We have adjusted the power of some cards. Click here to check out all the details!
All cards have an Attack and Health value. When a card's Health reaches 0, it will be destroyed.
Most cards will have a delay time. This is the number of turns it takes for the card to activate. Inactive cards will not attack, but can still be attacked.
Active cards will always attack the enemy card directly across from them.
If there is no enemy card across, an active card will instead attack the enemy Hero.
Victory is achieved by reducing the enemy Hero health to zero. If your Hero health is reduced to zero first, you will be Defeated.
Each turn, you draw a random card from your Deck to your Hand, as long as your Deck is not empty.
After you draw a card, you can play any card in your Hand.
Many cards have one or more Skills. Each skill has very different effects. Mastering Skills is necessary to become a successful Adventurer!

Skills can have several different targets. In some cases, skills may target random friendly or enemy cards. Other skills may target all cards. Others still can target specific types of cards - like Wyld or Frogs.
To overcome the toughest challenges, you will have to master the art of Deck Building! There are multiple ways to do improve your deck.
You can make your deck stronger by acquiring newer, higher rarity cards from Campaigns, Quests, and the Store.
You can also improve your deck by upgrading your cards. Upgrading will improve the Attack, Health, and Skills of your cards. Upgrade as often as you can!

Fusion is an advanced technique to improve cards. You can combine two cards of the same type if they are both at their Maximum Upgrade Level. The resulting card will be even better, and can always be further upgraded even more!
You can vaporize old and unused cards to gain additional Arcane Dust. Vaporized cards are removed permanently, but the Dust can be used to upgrade your most important Cards!
The best decks contain very rare, high level cards. You can also improve your deck by using cards with Skills that work well together.
Contains special goods to help a new Adventurer!
Contains special goods to help a worthy Adventurer!
Contains special goods to help a hardened Adventurer!
Contains special goods to help a seasoned Adventurer!
Instantly adds up to 1 more Bounty.
Instantly adds up to 3 more Bounties.
Instantly adds up to 5 more Bounties.
Instantly adds up to 10 more Bounties.
Instantly adds up to 20 more Bounties.
Combine 20 Arcane Fragments to create an Arcane Ore that can be vaporized for 30 Arcane Dust.
Increases your Energy recharge rate by 20% and gives a chance of finding Blue Fire Souls from missions.
Collect 40 Souls and combine them to create a random card.
Combine with 50 Smoldering Embers, 20 Obsidian Gravel, and 10 Essence of Dragonfire to hatch.
Gravel from the base of the Tarragon Peak, scorched by centuries of dragon's fire.
A smoldering ember gathered from the Tarragon Peak.
A single, tiny, slightly warm dragon hatchling. Needs the warmth of a mother dragon's fire.
Captured dragon's fire. Combine with 50 Dragon Hatchlings to earn the Dragon Tamer's trust.
Gives one random card guaranteed Rare or higher.
Gives one random card. Ten times!
Gives two cards with one guaranteed ^c8E5FRare ^cFFFFor higher.
Gives four cards with one guaranteed ^c0DFFEpic ^cFFFFor higher. Best chance at ^cE7FFLegendaries^cFFFF!
Gives four cards with one guaranteed ^cE7FFLegendary ^cFFFFor higher.
Send your Woodland Fairy into combat by dragging it onto the battlefield.
All cards have an Attack and Health value. When a card's health reaches zero, it disappears!
Now send a Moss Golem in! These big guys are slower, but they pack a big punch!
Many cards have a delay. It will take this number of turns for the card to activate and attack.
Reduce the enemy Hero's health to zero to achieve Victory!
You have the basics! Now let's see how you do on your own!
You're off to a great start! Let's continue our training!
You just completed a Quest! This is a great way to earn special rewards!
Make sure to check back with me often for new Quests! SQUAWK!
Here you can view all of the cards you currently have collected!
Drag cards between your inventory and deck to update your team! SQUAWK!!
On this screen you can choose cards you own to vaporize.
Vaporizing cards you no longer want permanently removes them but gives you Arcane Dust to use for card upgrades!
This is where you can upgrade your cards! Select a card and combine it with Arcane Dust to make it grow stronger!
Now that you have leveled a card to maximum level you can combine it with a matching maximum level card.
Doing this will create an all new fusion card!
This is your Tome of Heroes. Spend gold to recruit new heroes to your team!
But be warned, the most powerful of heroes will only join the team of powerful mages.
Come, check out the Bounty board. There are plenty of no-good hooligans on the loose!
Bounties offer big rewards for defeating other players! Make a name for yourself by defeating as many enemies as you can!
The store is where you can purchase new crystals that I have collected for you.
As a token of my gratitude, I will sell you this crystal I have brought from far away lands. A treasure like this, I can let it go for... 12,000 gold!
Hey! Don't ignore me! Why did you follow us back to the airship?
Okay, okay. Hm. You drive a tough bargain. How about... 100 gold!
Are you even listen- SQUAWK!? You dropped the price that much?!
You can return to Master campaigns you've already completed. They will get harder, but you can get better rewards!
Tap on the Mastery Star to see all of the rewards you can get from higher level Campaigns!
Great work! Now let's get right back into the action!
On this screen you can send out scout parties to complete missions and collect rewards!
Increasing your player level will increase your chances of success! So check back here often!
This creature is using Heal, which will return the missing health of an allied creature.
This creature has Armor, which will prevent a portion of attack damage dealt to it.
This creature has Bolt, which will deal damage to a random enemy creature.
This creature has Empower, which will temporarily increase an allied creature's attack.
This creature has Vengeance; it deals damage back to a creature that attacks it.
This creature has Weaken, which will temporarily decrease an enemy creature's attack.
This creature has Pierce; it ignores a portion of enemy Armor and Barriers.
This creature has Poison; enemy creatures damaged by this card take additional poison damage at the end of the turn.
This creature has Siphon; it will heal when it deals attack damage.
This creature has Invisibility; it will avoid a number of enemy skills.
This creature has Hex; enemy creatures who are hexed take additional damage.
This creature has Barrier, which will reduce the next damage dealt to an allied creature.
This creature has Enhance, which will increase the effect of the skill it is enhancing.
This creature has Freeze, which will prevent an enemy creature from attacking or activating skills for a turn.
This creature has Dualstrike; it will attack twice in a single turn.
This creature has Scorch; burned enemies will take stacking burn damage at the end of the turn until the fire wears off.

A nearby village needs help preventing Soul Wisps from wandering into their homes at night. Help Oda relocate them away from the villagers.
There have been reports of bandits taking monks hostage in a nearby cave. Help Oda investigate the cavern!
Yuriel has lost his most valuable incantation book! Help him search the library so he may continue his studies.
Yuriel is working on an improved spell for enhancing armor. He's asking someone to aid him with testing...
Samael's people have sighted a strange creature swimming in the nearby lake. Help investigate the disturbance.
There have been rumors of an assassin attending Samael's upcoming ball. Help secure his palace by providing extra security.
A source has reported rare dark magic artifacts in the black markets of Luminis. Aria may have use for these...
Aria is asking for 7 Beetle Toes, 1 bag of Bat Guano, and 5 Bloodroot leaves. She said not to ask questions...
Decim burned through another sweatshirt and needs a new one, but only will wear the premium wool found Elaria.
A small village outside Karthos has 'mysteriously' caught fire. Help subdue the flames!
A Fire Titan has escaped and is rampaging through a near by market. The town is in need of our support!
Tarian has requested aid to help contain a swarm of lava crabs. They have been pinching everything in sight!
Elyse has discovered an ancient text about the history of Elaria! Helping her translate may provide clues to our journey.
Elyse has found a rare herb that can be used for pain relief. Help her gather these herbs in the Northern Woods.
Ursurio wants you to collect a shipment of salmon from the rivers of Luminis. The denizens of the river might not enjoy the idea as much.
Rumors have spread about a new type of tasty fish in the oceans south of the continent. Collect some for... scientific reasons.
A heavy storm passed through the woods near the ocean. Help clear the fallen trees and flooding.
Undead have invaded the deep forests and disturbed the natural elements. Remove them and restore balance to the grove.
The Elaria Expedition needs an escort for their researchers. Help them travel to the new dig site.
A friend has suggested the Elaria Captain pick up a book to read. Travel to Luminis and find a copy of 'Language and Grammar: A Beginner's Guide'
Malchior appears to be feeling home sick. He requested you to send him some "Lomalife lite", two cups of "Perpestrulatum" and a "bag of chestnuts".
Malchior suspects the mountains to the west of Karthos to be rich with Spellstones. Be the first to find them!
A child has gone missing near the Southern Woods. Witnesses last spotted him near a known wolf den.
Farms have been having trouble keeping the woodland beasts out of their stock. Help clear the woods of creatures!
An Angelic Knight has gotten her wings caught in the briar patch. She needs our help to escape.
The Aether angels have started battling void minions on the edge of The Void. Lend them aid!
Raven says we need grubs to help Elyse with a very important potion. Help him search in the near by swamp!
Your airship's engine is on its last leg. Travel to the city and collect the parts needed to repair it.
A small Soul Wisp has been sneaking in and stealing the Goblin's goods. Set up a trap and catch the creature.
Tarian needs a brave adventurer to defeat the Orobas that has been blocking a nearby bridge. It has been attacking travelers who attempt to cross.
The Balrog has taken residence outside Karthos. This wouldn't be a problem normally, but it drank the lava lake and is passing especially potent gas.
A sailor reported hearing the cries of a small girl coming from the ocean. He hasn't returned from his investigation yet...
Mermaids have been seen placing spells on the frogs of the Luminis rivers. They started attacking the villagers, help stop them!
An evil baron has been imprisoning the innocent. Sneak into his estates and free them without getting caught.
An assassination attempt has been made on a Luminis noble. They are looking to hire additional nightly guards.
Void Minions have appeared in the woods around the Elaria Expedition. Help the Elaria Captain defeat the monsters before they harm the researchers!
The city of Luminis is under attack from Void Minions. Defeat them before they hurt the civilians!
A wraith has been seen during Aria's spell incantations. Perhaps it is someone from her past? Help her reach out to the spirit.
Wraiths have been heard from the graveyards near the Void. Help Aria with an incantation that can put them to rest peacefully.
The Monstrosity has arose from The Void once more. Defeat it and make sure it does not rise again!
The Void Monstrosity is spreading its influence across the continent. Bring it down and restore balance to the region
A Fire Titan has broken into the inner city of Luminis. Defeat it before it destroys everything!
A Fire Titan has gathered an army of undead near the forests of Luminis. Defeat it and disperse the army before it turns its attention on the Expedition.
The maniac general that attacked Elaria is on the loose again, terrorizing a port city on the oceans near Luminis.
A disturbance has been reported in the Salt Wastes. A strange man has been breaking into ruins in search of something. Find out what they are after.
A band of skeletons has made off with some brushes used to uncover buried treasures in Elaria. Track them down!
A rogue skeleton stole the main course of a banquet feast in a nearby town. We're not sure what he will do with it, but bring it back!
The Tremor Wurm has exploded directly in the center of a town hall on the edge of The Void. Defeat it before it eats everything in sight!
A great Tremor Wurm twice the size of the one you fought in The Void has appeared in the wilderness. Defeat it before it's too late!
Elyse is requesting special packaging so she can send a gift to her family back home. We should be able to pick up the packaging in any nearby village.
Another wave of new adventurers has landed in Arcantica and have already stumbled into the undead. Help the Ranger guide the new recruits!
Since his ship wreck Oda has developed a fear of the sea. Perhaps a surprise boat trip will help him overcome his fears!
A lone skeleton has wandered into the Elaria Expedition. Find where it's hiding and take it out before it hurts someone!
The goblin lost one of his crates of Spellstones when the undead attacked! If you help him find it, he will let you keep one.
Tip: Use your Arcane Dust to upgrade your cards!
Tip: Spend your gold to buy Spellstones in the Store!
Tip: Earn more rewards by completing Bounties!

Adventurers arrive in waves, with hopes of power and rare treasures.
The treasures they seek are Spellstones, which contain magical creatures from a time long past.
Hopeful adventurers speak of one of the Elder Treasures - a Heart of Blue Fire. You are here to find it.
Alright! It's time to prepare for yer quest. The Heart of Blue Fire ain't going to find itself!
So, I assume this is another new adventurer looking for the great treasure? Let's see what you can do!

The Void is taking a heavy toll on the Kingdom. Do you know of a way to banish them?
The Void is a growing threat for them as well, but I understand. If I bring the young back to the village, may I examine the artifact?
